resources.string: AQI - stand for Air Quality Index - is a system for reporting the severity of air quality levels in relatable terms to the public. This index has a value in the range of 0 - 500, where high the index values indicate higher the level of air pollution and higher potential for adverse health effects. Any value larger than 300, for example, is considered to be hazardous, meanwhile an AQI value of 0 - 50, on the other hand, represents good air quality.

PM2.5 particles are floating particulate matter in the air measuring 2.5 micrometer in diameter or less. PM2.5 is so small it can be absorbed into th bloodstream upon inhalation. For this reason, it is typically the pollutant posing the greatest health thread.

resources.string: PM10 is suspended particulate matter in th air with a diameter of 10 micrometers or less (including smoke, soot, slats, acids, and metals). The different between PM10 and PM2.5 is simply a matter of size - while PM2.5 is fine, PM10 is larger and coarser.
